body: Inspired by and built on #13720

Concept ACK

Nit: macOS ships with GNU bash, albeit an ancient version. Please change "helps ensure ongoing compatibility with BSD bash as well as GNU bash" to something along the lines of "helps ensure ongoing compatibility with the macOS BSD user land and the ancient version of GNU bash shipped with macOS".

```
/usr/local/Homebrew/Library/Homebrew/brew.rb:12:in `<main>': Homebrew must be run under Ruby 2.3! You're running 2.0.0. (RuntimeError)
```
~wip: I’m rolling back to 10.10~

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
Might as well do a full depends and bitcoind build when pulling in macos anyway?
ACK d5d76655105d6d338dbc367ae0b54b7433ffeb38

utACK d5d7665

Closing my PR #13720 in favour of this one.

There are some non-travis related changes here, which should be submitted independently, imo.

I.e. all commits to b24ee7680cd1b5932cd3092113bcef2fe2db5d19 might go to a separate pull.
@MarcoFalke FYI those changes are required to make the lint stage pass when also run on Mac, so I included them to make this PR green. Will extract a second PR for them in case that's helpful.

~On second thought I instead set up CI runs against this PR with each of the prior commits excluded, to demonstrate the associated failure:
sans 4874450 / empty subexpressions: https://travis-ci.org/Empact/bitcoin/builds/421218998
sans 28d520b / SC1087: https://travis-ci.org/Empact/bitcoin/builds/421219652
sans a442c33 / SC1117: https://travis-ci.org/Empact/bitcoin/jobs/421201432
sans 21ff32e / SC2206: https://travis-ci.org/Empact/bitcoin/builds/421219244
sans 2917ecd / SC2207: https://travis-ci.org/Empact/bitcoin/builds/421220532
sans f65efb2 / SC2230: https://travis-ci.org/Empact/bitcoin/builds/421219961~
Rebased for #14115. This now only adds the mac-based lint run to CI.

utACK 453daa0.
Maybe put it in test stage. It takes 3 minutes to boot and 4 minutes to run the script.

utACK 453daa0e24ae441175f413dd03460417eb4f4ee5

Will be great to have this in Travis!

nit: Remove Linux in PR title? :-)
Moved it into a 3rd/final "Compat" stage. Sound good?
Should be marked "up for grabs"?
@Empact Looks like you've rebased since Marco's comment? Travis had errored out, so I restarted, but it now seems to be stalled while installing dependencies with `brew`?
@fanquake FYI I'm picking this back up.
~Currently based on #15257 in order to give myself a clean build locally. Happy to base otherwise.~

~Outstanding work: need to install git with USE_LIBPCRE~

> ~fatal: cannot use Perl-compatible regexes when not compiled with USE_LIBPCRE~

(done)
ACK eefbc9d. Looking forward to seeing more stuff tested on the macOS native build.
<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->Needs rebase
I am going to merge this under the "experimental umbrella", as it might be needed for  #16597

It takes about 10 minutes to boot the macOS on travis. If that is too long, we can revert this.

> It takes about 10 minutes to boot the macOS on travis.

@MarcoFalke Any idea why it takes that long?

> @MarcoFalke Any idea why it takes that long?

because travis 🤷

The backlog for macOS can be seen here: https://www.traviscistatus.com/

note to myself: It failed here: https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/595893060#L2470

I think it's bad that this change seems to now require scripted diffs to run in the macos unix environment. It makes me less inclined to write scripted diffs if I have to somehow get them them to work in macos when I don't use the operating system, and don't have the hardware, and all the unix tools are strange and old.

Also, does this scripted-diff checking script itself not function on macos...?

https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/598935472

```sh
$ set -o errexit; source ./ci/lint/06_script.sh
sed: 1: "/^-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT- ...": unexpected EOF (pending }'s)
Error: missing script for: 3c5edd40ae63daee4de6c58ea4123c66be83119c
Failed
sed: 1: "/^-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT- ...": unexpected EOF (pending }'s)
Error: missing script for: 7e271ea765b731c59edbc62790f568af284c7800
Failed
```
There are some tools / homebrew packages to make macOS scripts behave more like Linux. E.g. https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/gnu-sed
Ok, then lets remove this and macOS users should use the gnu utils that are provided by brew

diff_hunk:
@@ -105,3 +110,34 @@ jobs:
               while read LINE; do travis_retry gpg --keyserver hkp://subset.pool.sks-keyservers.net --recv-keys $LINE; done < contrib/verify-commits/trusted-keys &&
               travis_wait 50 contrib/verify-commits/verify-commits.py;
           fi
+    - stage: lint BSD
+      os: osx
+      # Use macOS consistent with the minimum supported version: 10.11
body: If you mean our next supported minimum macOS version, shouldn't this be 10.10?

diff_hunk:
@@ -105,3 +110,34 @@ jobs:
               while read LINE; do travis_retry gpg --keyserver hkp://subset.pool.sks-keyservers.net --recv-keys $LINE; done < contrib/verify-commits/trusted-keys &&
               travis_wait 50 contrib/verify-commits/verify-commits.py;
           fi
+    - stage: lint BSD
+      os: osx
+      # Use macOS consistent with the minimum supported version: 10.11
body: Thanks - was relying on faulty memory. Also it happens to be the earliest version supported by Travis. Updated. #13617

diff_hunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,8 @@
 sudo: required
 dist: trusty
-os: linux
+os:
+  - linux
+  - osx
body: AFAIK it is not required to enumerate `osx` here.

diff_hunk:
@@ -11,6 +13,7 @@ cache:
 stages:
   - lint
   - test
+  - lint macOS
body: you can use the same stage `lint` - it will have this stage with two jobs, one in linux, one in macOS

diff_hunk:
@@ -81,6 +84,8 @@ after_script:
     - echo $TRAVIS_COMMIT_LOG
 
 jobs:
+  exclude:
+    - os: osx
body: this would not be required either if not mentioning it in the `os` section globally

               travis_wait 50 contrib/verify-commits/verify-commits.py;
           fi
+    - stage: lint macOS

diff_hunk:
@@ -135,3 +135,24 @@ jobs:
         RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false
         GOAL="all deploy"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui --enable-reduce-exports --enable-werror"
+# OSX bash compatibility
+    - stage: compat
+      os: osx
+      # Use the earliest macOS that can build our lint dependencies:
+      # Xcode 7.3.1, macOS 10.11, JDK 1.8.0_92-b14
+      # Earlier versions failed to make and install ghc for shellcheck
+      # https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/reference/osx/#OS-X-Version
+      osx_image: xcode7.3
+      # TODO: if you're updating osx_image, try using rvm: to supply the version of ruby
+      # required by homebrew. Could not get this working with xcode7.3 but believe it should
body: It says `osx_image: xcode7.3` and at the same time `could not get this working with xcode7.3`

diff_hunk:
@@ -135,3 +135,24 @@ jobs:
         RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false
         GOAL="all deploy"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-gui --enable-reduce-exports --enable-werror"
+# OSX bash compatibility
+    - stage: compat
+      os: osx
+      # Use the earliest macOS that can build our lint dependencies:
+      # Xcode 7.3.1, macOS 10.11, JDK 1.8.0_92-b14
+      # Earlier versions failed to make and install ghc for shellcheck
+      # https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/reference/osx/#OS-X-Version
+      osx_image: xcode7.3
+      # TODO: if you're updating osx_image, try using rvm: to supply the version of ruby
+      # required by homebrew. Could not get this working with xcode7.3 but believe it should
body: That's correct - I could not get the `rvm: 2.3.7` setting working in the version used here, so had to use `brew update` in the install script. Updated the comment to clarify what "this" is.

body: Yeah, sorry this is WIP. I pulled the `brew install` command from some defunct docs I think.

diff_hunk:
@@ -99,6 +100,30 @@ jobs:
       script:
         - set -o errexit; source .travis/extended_lint_06_script.sh
 
+    - stage: extended-lint
+      name: 'extended-lint macOS 10.12 (compat)'
+      os: osx
+      # Use the earliest macOS that can build our lint dependencies:
+      # Xcode 8.3.3, macOS 10.12, JDK 1.8.0_112-b16
+      # https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/reference/osx/#OS-X-Version
+      osx_image: xcode8.3
+      # TODO: if you're updating osx_image, try using "rvm:" to supply the
+      # version of ruby required by homebrew. Despite this "rvm:" declaration,
+      # brew update installs ruby 2.3.7 as its first action.
+      language: ruby
+      rvm:
+        - 2.3.7
+      # clear default env
+      env:
+      sudo: false
body: I'm pretty sure you can drop sudo here.

diff_hunk:
@@ -6,10 +6,23 @@
 
 export LC_ALL=C
 
-travis_retry pip install codespell==1.15.0
-travis_retry pip install flake8==3.5.0
-travis_retry pip install vulture==0.29
+if [ "$TRAVIS_OS_NAME" == "osx" ]; then
+  # update first to install required ruby dependency
+  travis_retry brew update
+  travis_retry brew reinstall git -- --with-pcre2 # for  --perl-regexp
body: I don't think `--with-pcre2` is a `git` install option anymore? Or is this being passed because we're using an old version of `brew` or something?

diff_hunk:
@@ -6,9 +6,22 @@
 
 export LC_ALL=C
 
+if [ "$TRAVIS_OS_NAME" == "osx" ]; then
+  # update first to install required ruby dependency
+  travis_retry brew update
+  travis_retry brew install grep # gnu grep for --perl-regexp support
+  PATH="$(brew --prefix grep)/libexec/gnubin:$PATH"
+  travis_retry brew install shellcheck
+  travis_retry brew upgrade python
+  PATH="$(brew --prefix python)/bin:$PATH"
+  export PATH
+else
+  SHELLCHECK_VERSION=v0.6.0
+  curl -s "https://storage.googleapis.com/shellcheck/shellcheck-${SHELLCHECK_VERSION}.linux.x86_64.tar.xz" | tar --xz -xf - --directory /tmp/
body: Probably a good idea to add a `travis_retry` here as well

Ah, looks like setup_env is already running (because the `before_install` step is inherited.

https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/595662274#L125
